messages.content: Are llms better at machine translation than rule-based translators?

Yes, they are. Llms are better at machine translation because they can learn from data and generate more accurate translations than rule-based systems. Llms can take into account context, word order, and other nuances that rule-based systems cannot. They are also better at dealing with out-of-vocabulary words and can generate more natural-sounding translations.
when llms translate fictional works, are they more capable of replicating tone and characterization better than rule-based translators?

Yes, llms are better able to replicate tone and characterization than rule-based translators. Llms can take into account the context of a sentence, for example, and generate more accurate translations that reflect the nuances of a story. They can also generate more natural-sounding translations and are better at dealing with out-of-vocabulary words.
